item.title: CHM101A
item.description: This introductory laboratory course on chemistry to be done by all first year students. Materials Practical File (2013) Practical File (2017) Sample Report Grading Key

item.title: CHM102A
item.description: This introductory course on chemistry to be done by all first year students. The course content is divided into two parts. The first half consists of Organic Chemistry concepts, many of which are repititions of those that we studied during our JEE preparation. The second half consists of Physical Chemistry. Books & Other References Physical Chemistry (by Peter Atkins) 2019-20-II Quiz-1 Tutorials Midsem

item.title: EE200A
item.description: This introductory course is the first core course to be done by all students under Electrical Engineering branch. The course content is very straight-forward and easy. A little amount of time per week on a regular basis can do the work. There are some conventions and definitions to be understood (not rememebered) and the most important and the only major topic is the Laplace Transform. Till Midsem, analog signals are covered while after midsem, digitals signals are taught but all concepts taught in the second half are almost same as the first half, the only difference being that they are applied on digital/discrete signals instead of analog signals.

item.title: EE210A
item.description: This course is a DC course, to be done in the 4th semester by the Electrical Engineering branch. This course is the first course which will give you the feeling of what a specialisation in core electrical might look like. The course content includes discussions on diodes, BJTs and MOSFETs in the beginning, and then the complex structures, like amplifiers and output stages, are presented to you. Amplifier is the most element so make sure that you understand its properties.

item.title: EE250A
item.description: This course is a DC course, to be done in the 4th semester by the Electrical Engineering branch. This course introduces you to a specific field of core electrical engineering, namely control systems, which have profound usgae in almost all controlled machinery like robotics. This course is somparatively easy than other core courses. Laplace transform, taught in EE200, is the only mathematical tool used for almost all tasks. Books & Other References Control System: Principle and Design (by Madan Gopal) Automatic Control Systems (by Farid Golnaraghi, Benjamin C.

item.title: ESC101A
item.description: This course is a IC course, to be done in the 1st and 2nd semester by all students. This course introduces you to basic programming in C. Books & Other References Let us C (by Yashavant Kanetkar) 2019-20-II Minor Quizzes Major Quiz 1 Midsem

item.title: ESC201A
item.description: This course is a IC course, to be done in the 3rd and 4th semester by all students. This is one of those courses which should spark the interest in you towards the Electrical Engineerinb branch. It is also a very important course w.r.t to your involvement in core opportunities, be it projects, internships or placements. The course has three parts. The first part consists of the basics and fundamentals of current electricity like KVL, KCL, RLC circuits, etc.

item.title: ESO203A
item.description: This course is a DC course for Electrical Engineering and Mechanical Engineering students. The objective of this course is to introduce us to power systems and electrical engineering behind power transmission. The first is focused on revising basic electrical concepts like KVL, KCL, etc. The second half introduces transformers, motors and generators (both DC and AC) with a tonne of calculations. Books & Other References Fundamentals of Electric Circuits (by C.

item.title: ESO213A
item.description: This course is an ESO course offered by the Earth Sciences Department. Books & Other References Earth Portrait of a Planet (by Stephen Marshak) Understanding Earth (by John Grotzinger, Thomas H. Jordan) 2020-21-I Quiz 1 Quiz 2 Midsem

item.title: LIF101A
item.description: This course is an IC course offered by the Biological Sciences and Bioengineering Department. Books & Other References Biology: Concepts and Applications by Cecie Starr 2019-20-I Nothing here Yet :(
